p: Absolute quantification of Wolbachia in mosquitoes were analyzed in the heads and thoraces of Wolbachia-positive mosquitoes ( wMel +) after challenge with YFV. There was no difference in Wolbachia density among heads and thoraces, collected at 7 or 14 days post feeding (dpf), as shown in Figure 3A. However, Wolbachia density presented a slight reduction at 21dpf, which was statistically significant in relation to 14dpf ( p = 0.0062, Mann Whitney). The median at 14dpf was 2.04 × 10 6 copies per head/thorax whereas at 21dpf, it decreased to 1.37 × 10 6.
